ITrackball.h

This file defines the published interface for talking to the track ball manipulator.

ETrackballConstraint
enum
ETrackballConstraint

Defines available constraints for the trackball object

Constraint_None

Don't constrain rotations

Constraint_XAxis

Constrain rotations to be around X axis

Constraint_YAxis

Constrain rotations to be around Y axis

Constraint_ZAxis

Constrain rotations to be around Z axis

Header

#include "Rendering/Caustic/ITrackball.h"

ITrackball

Defines the interface to our trackball implementation

Header

#include "Rendering/Caustic/ITrackball.h"

int 
screenX,
int 
screenY,
int 
screenW,
int 
screenH
) = 0

Called to start tracking

Parameters
screenX
int

mouse's X position where tracking starts in pixels

screenY
int

mouse's Y position where tracking starts in pixels

screenW
int

width of the window in pixels

screenH
int

height of the window in pixels

int 
screenX,
int 
screenY,

constraint,
DirectX::

*

) = 0

Called when mouse moves during trackball tracking

Parameters
screenX
int

screenY
int

current mouse's Y position

constraint
ETrackballConstraint

current constraint

pMatrix
DirectX::XMMATRIX*

Resulting trackball matrix

EndTracking
virtual void EndTracking() = 0

Called when mouse is released during trackball tracking

CreateTrackball
CRefObj<ITrackball> CreateTrackball()

Global function for creating a track ball. This method should generally not be called. Use the ICausticFactory to create new Caustic objects.

Returns

Returns the newly created trackball.

#include "Rendering/Caustic/ITrackball.h"
